title: Interactive Learning Design in Online Writing Education: Application of the Community of Inquiry (CoI) Framework

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Writing Skills and Experience Using Online Learning Platforms
context.additional_context: Project-based collaboration in a BYOD (Bring Your Own Device) environment to improve writing skills and establish a peer feedback system

learning_goals: Students collaboratively co-author documents in real-time with peers using online collaboration tools (e.g., Google Docs) and improve feedback-based writing skills
Through asynchronous discussions, learners analyze diverse perspectives and integrate them into their writing to demonstrate critical thinking

Learners can design and evaluate interaction strategies among peers by applying the three elements of the Community of Inquiry (CoI) framework: social presence, teaching presence, and cognitive presence

resources: Online collaboration platform (Google Workspace, Zoom, etc.)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
